_prev_prog_2.FR_OtherType: Texas Railroad Commission Statewide Rule 61 Certificate of Compliance which regulated gasoline plants in the State of Texas
_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: Facility is scheduled to be in compliance with NFPA-58 by 6/21/99
_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: In case of overfill or over-pressurization of the vessel, the vent line is hooked up to suction line of compressor which sends the vapors released from the vessels to gas sales line.
_prev_prog_2.MD_OtherType: Daily fluid level and pressure data recording by field pumper.
_prev_prog_2.TR_OtherType: Employees will be provided refresher training every three years as required by the RMP regulations.  New emplyees will be provided on the job training regarding operation of the facility.
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Pressurized storage vessel and associated valves and piping, Refrigeration unit and associated valves and piping.
_prev_prog_2.Description: The Prevention Program developed for the facility applies to the pressurized storage vessel usedto store the natural gas liquids at the facility and the refrigeration unit which extracts the NGL from the natural gas which passes through the facility.  This prevention program is kept on file in the field office located nearset to the facility.  The facility operator also keeps a copy with him at all times.  The prevention program which has been implmented at this site includes the following: 1) Safety Information, 2) Hazard Review, 3) Operating Procedures, 4) Training Procedures, 5) Maintenance Procedures, 6) Compliance Audits, 7) Incident Investigations, 8) Emergency Response, 9) Management system, and 10) Employee/Contractor Certification.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidential release prevention and emergency response policies at this facility:  This facility currently complies with Texas Railroad Commission State Wide Rule 61 covering the operation of gasoline (NGL) plants in the State of Texas.  By June 21, 1999, we also plan to be in compliance with NFPA-58, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Houston County Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

Description of facility and regulated substances handled:  The LaRue #1 is the site of an oil and gas production well equipped with a refrigeration gas plant to extract natural gas liquids from the natural gas prior to the gas entering a sales pipeline.  The natural gas extracted from the well passes through a refrigeration unit where the natural gas is chilled to below freezing temperatures.  The gas then enters a separator which allows the natural gas liquids to drop out of the gasand accumulate in a separator.  The liquids (flammable mixture) are then dumped under pressure to a single 12,000 gallon pressurized storage vessel.  The liquids are stored in this vessel until a sufficient quantity has accumulated inside the vessel to conduct a sale.  The natural gas liquids are removed from the site by use of transport trucks. 

The worst-case and alternative release scenarios:  Our worst-case scenario is the failure of the 12,000 gallon pressurized storage vessel when filled to capacity, resulting in a vapor cloud explosion of the flammable mixture stored in the vessel.  The resulting distance to the endpoint extends offsite, and one public receptor is within the distance to the endpoint.  The worst-case scenarios did not take into account any active or passive mitigation scenarios.  Our alternative release scenario is a break in a 2-inch diameter loading hose leading to a 15-minute release of a flammable mixture (13,659 lbs.) and an explosion.  Ac
